p: We took into account in the analyses all bird species observed in at least eight squares throughout the atlases ( N = 235). We excluded only one species, the Arctic redpoll Carduelis hornemanni, because new knowledge of the identification of the Arctic redpoll emerged between the atlases so that bird observers could identify the species more reliably (Valkama et al., 2011). However, based on genetic analyses, the species status of the Arctic redpoll is not clear (Marthinsen, Wennerberg, & Lifjeld, 2008).
